intro: Boechera perennans subsp. texana, commonly known as the Texas rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization in its native habitat.
